metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15138 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Prism is vulnerable to Cross-Site Scripting. The easing preview of thePreviewers plugin has an XSS vulnerability that allows attackers to executearbitrary code in Safari and Internet Explorer. This impacts all Safari andInternet Explorer users of Prism >=v1.1.0 that use the _Previewers_ plugin(>=v1.10.0) or the _Previewer: Easing_ plugin (v1.1.0 to v1.9.0). Thisproblem is fixed in version 1.21.0. To workaround the issue withoutupgrading, disable the easing preview on all impacted code blocks. You needPrism v1.10.0 or newer to apply this workaround.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15138` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-prismjs - 1.11.0+dfsg-4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: node-prismjs package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.11.0+dfsg-4').
